Consumption

Things that I consume

movie

2025-11-25

28 Days Later

Danny Boyle

November 1st, 2002

★★★★☆ ½

Going in to this movie the only thing I knew about it was that it had something to do with a quarantine. Oh boy did this blow away my expectations. I was so captivated by everything in this movie. The acting, the shots, the colors, the soundtrack (!!).

game

2025-11-25

The Last of Us

Naughty Dog

★★★★☆

This is another game that caught me by surprise in how much I liked it. As a lifelong contrarion, I wasn’t into zombies when the era took over. Now that several years have passed, I finally played through it with my wife and- yeah, it’s a really gripping story.

manga

2025-11-25

Solanin

Inio Asano

2005

★★★★☆

Look, I’m gonna write my actual thoughts on this later but right now I just need to fill up this container with text so that I can test out my website :).

anime

2025-11-24

Terror in Resonance

Shinichiro Watanabe

July-September, 2014

★★★☆☆

What the fuck is the girl even doing in this? She’s just so lost, man. I mean the two terrorists have some kind of secret training backstory and the girl has something going on with her mom, but like?

music

2025-11-24

The Fat of the Land

The Prodigy

★★★☆☆ ½

This shit rips.

take my PIC-chaaaa smack by BITCH uuuuuup

music

2025-11-24

Beyond the Fleeting Gales

Crying

October 14th, 2016

★★★★★

This is just me gushing about how much I love this album! From start to finish the lyricism and emotionality is so beautiful. It starts off with a very powerful, huge sound in “Premonitory Dream” and “Wool in the Wash” and later cools down to such slow beauty with “Well and Spring”. By the time you reach the next to last track, “Beyond the Fleeting Gales”, it feels like you’ve reached not only the end of a journey, but the end of all journeys. I’d list it as one of my “beautiful songs to watch the end of the world to”.

Support the Artist

J. R. R. Tolkien

★★★★☆ ½

This shit was so good, dude.
